snippet: On March 2, 1877, only three days before his inauguration, the Republican Rutherford B. Hayes was declared the winner of the 1876 presidential election, defeating the Democrat Samuel J. Tilden in one of the most disputed elections in American...
abstract: On March 2, 1877, only three days before his inauguration, the Republican Rutherford B. Hayes was declared the winner of the 1876 presidential election, defeating the Democrat Samuel J. Tilden in one of the most disputed elections in American history.

headline.main: March 2, 1877 | Hayes Declared Winner in Disputed Presidential Election
